image.altText: A young Asian woman looks into the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: After a new survey revealed half of migrant women had experienced sexual harassment in Australian workplaces, workers are speaking out and calling for change.

title.children: Some women groped at work told it's just a 'cultural thing' in Australia

image.altText: A close up image of Kevin Rudd with his hand on his chin.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton has toughened his language about Kevin Rudd's appointment as Australia's ambassador to the US, after a top Trump aide appeared to suggest his time in the role was coming to an end.

title.children: Dutton pins Rudd's appointment to US on Albanese, as Trump loyalist taunts former PM

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Two recent events have given Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton some ideas about what issues might be election winners — and what won't be.

title.children: As their election test looms, Albanese and Dutton learn two valuable lessons

image.altText: Jackson Irvine takes a selfie

props.synopsis: The Socceroos' road to the 2026 World Cup reaches a crucial juncture with a critical qualifier against Saudi Arabia at Melbourne's AAMI Park. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Socceroos host Saudi Arabia in crunch World Cup qualifier

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The state of play in Group C

image.altText: A large bonfire lights up the night with twisted branches going up in flames and smoke.

props.synopsis: Push it over. Pile it up. Strike a match. That's been the fate of thousands of avocado trees as growers destroy entire paddocks in search of more profitable crops.

title.children: Bulldozers rip out thousands of avocado trees amid Far North orchard exodus

props.synopsis: As parliamentarians gathered for a preliminary vote on the bill on Thursday, Te Pāti Māori MPs physically tore a copy of the bill, stood and began a haka.

title.children: New Zealand Parliament suspended after haka protest

image.altText: a man with large spectacles and suit

props.synopsis: Nouriel Roubini predicted the Global Financial Crisis, now he is warning president-elect Donald Trump's tariff and deregulation plans could lead to stagflation.

title.children: Economist who predicted GFC warns about Trump's economic plans

image.altText: A Indigenous woman wearing glasses, a black jacket and a red scarf, rests her arms on a wooden table

props.synopsis: This year, the Waanyi author of Carpentaria, Tracker and Praiseworthy has won the Stella Prize, the Miles Franklin Literary Award, and now the Melbourne Prize for Literature.

title.children: Alexis Wright becomes first Aboriginal author to win the $60,000 Melbourne Prize for Literature

image.altText: The US Capitol building

props.synopsis: It means the party has recorded a clean sweep in the US elections, winning the presidency, the Senate, and now the House of Representatives.

title.children: Republicans win majority in US House of Representatives

image.altText: A man sits behind a large desk with multiple microphones in the background and a man speaks on a virtual call on a laptop

props.synopsis: ASIC says it has done a thorough investigation into all super funds in the country and more court action is likely.

title.children: Cbus industry super fund apologises for 'far from perfect' behaviour

image.altText: Silhouette of children in the Kimberley on a beach at sunset.

props.synopsis: Advocates call for urgent action to implement a commissioner for young people in New South Wales, with First Nations children 12 times more likely to be in out-of-home care.

title.children: 'Everything was such a shock to me': The reality behind the rising number of out-of-home children

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A NSW police officer tells a jury she attempted twice to grab a knife out of Clare Nowland's hands in the moments before the aged care resident was tasered by her colleague Senior Constable Kristian White.

title.children: 'I thought I was going to be stabbed': Police officer tells court of failed attempts to disarm 95yo

image.altText: Donald Trump and Joe Biden sit in the Oval Office and shake hands.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden welcomes his long-time nemesis, Donald Trump, back to the White House for an undoubtedly uncomfortable Oval Office meeting to discuss the transition of power.

title.children: Trump says he and Biden 'enjoyed seeing each other' in almost two-hour meeting

image.altText: Job ads in a newspaper.

props.synopsis: Australia's unemployment rate remained at 4.1pc in October, as 15,900 more people found employment.

title.children: Australia's unemployment rate remained steady in October at 4.1pc

image.altText: Damien Richardson speaking

props.synopsis: Former actor Damien Richardson is being investigated by Victoria Police after being filmed jokingly performing the Nazi salute at an event attended by some Neo-Nazis.

title.children: Former soap star filmed doing Nazi salute at event far-right activists attended

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Patrick Orren Stephenson, 23, has pleaded not guilty to a charge of murder after the disappearance of Ballarat mum Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Husband in courtroom to hear man accused of murdering Samantha Murphy plead not guilty

image.altText: A fatberg is removed from Sydney's sewer system by heavy machinery.

props.synopsis: A group of engineers have invented a protective coating for concrete pipes that could help drastically reduce the presence of fatbergs — congealed masses of oils, grease and sanitary items – that block the sewer system.

title.children: A new invention could wipe away nearly one third of the 'fatbergs' in our sewers

image.altText: A man lays flowers outside where a man rammed his car into people

props.synopsis: President Xi Jinping has called for strict punishment of the perpetrator, about whom authorities have provided little information.

title.children: Chinese authorities clear flowers, candles as details of crash that killed 35 heavily censored

image.altText: The Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby wears a purple top and chain with a cross as he walks in Westminster

props.synopsis: A man who survived abuse as a child at the hands of his Anglican priest says the Church should "beg" for forgiveness after it a report revealed that the Archbishop of Canterbury had knowledge of sexual abuse at Christian camps.

title.children: Child abuse survivor says Anglican Church should have learnt from Australia's Royal Commission

image.altText: chef Jamie Oliver posing for a photo in a jacket with his hands together in front of his body

props.synopsis: Jamie Oliver has become embroiled in controversy after criticism his new book stereotypes Indigenous Australians. Here's where it all went wrong.

title.children: 'Our publishing standards fell short': Where Jamie Oliver's children's book went wrong

image.altText: An elderly man with grey hair and a moustache.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest into the disappearance of Peter Claux, who went missing on a dog walk on the NSW far south coast, has found he likely died in thick vegetation in a national park a short distance from his car.

title.children: Inquest hears elderly man missing for two years likely died in bushland walking the dog

image.altText: A yellow helicopter flies over the red landscape of the George Gill Range.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners say they hope the park's new listing will trigger action to prevent the spread of an invasive grass species that's changing the ancient landscape.

title.children: Watarrka National Park, home to popular Kings Canyon, placed on National Heritage List

image.altText: Marcus Acacius fights gladiator Lucius Verus

props.synopsis: More than two decades since Russell Crowe fought for democracy, Ridly Scott is back with the sequel to his epic Gladiator – a violent story of revenge and glory.

title.children: A villainous Denzel Washington steals the show from a beefed-up Paul Mescal in Gladiator II

image.altText: a man smiling sitting next to a woman wearing a wedding dress

props.synopsis: The mother of paramedic Steven Tougher, who was repeatedly stabbed while at a McDonald's at Campbelltown in Sydney's south-west, confronts her son's killer in the NSW Supreme Court.

title.children: Mother of murdered paramedic tells killer to 'rot in hell' during emotional impact statement

image.altText: A gun coloured  white and blue

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a man and seized a water pistol following reports that a replica gun was allegedly fired today in Sydney's CBD near parliament house.

title.children: Water pistol seized as man arrested over alleged shooting of replica gun near NSW parliament

image.altText: Dyson Daniels celebrates with Onyeka Okongwu

props.synopsis: Dyson Daniels announces his arrival as one of the league's premier ball hawks as LeBron James, Stephen Curry and Kevin Durant remain ageless. Here is what we've learned so far from the 2024-25 NBA season.

title.children: Boomers star sets incredible 21-year defensive first as iconic trio refuses to go quietly — five quick hits from the NBA's opening weeks

image.altText: A plume of smoke rising out of a residential district full of apartment blocks in Beirut.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah strongholds in Beirut have endured another day of Israeli bombardment, as Lebanon waited to hear details of a proposed ceasefire from the US.

title.children: Six Israeli soldiers killed in Lebanon as Beirut hit by second day of air strikes

image.altText: A scuba diver swims alongside a giant brown undulating standalone coral.

props.synopsis: Scientists say they have discovered the world's largest coral — measuring longer than a blue whale — on an expedition in Solomon Islands.

title.children: Scientists discover 'astonishingly large' coral thought to be biggest in the world

image.altText: Flowers and soft toys lie at the base of the primary school sign

props.synopsis: Even with 20 pegs anchoring the jumping castle, the "final outcome" of the Tasmanian Hillcrest tragedy would have been the same, a court has been told.

title.children: No amount of safety anchors would have stopped Hillcrest jumping castle becoming airborne, court told

image.altText: A satellite image of smoke blowing out of a volcano

props.synopsis: Flights in and out of Bali are resuming today after volcanic eruptions clouded parts of Indonesia with dangerous ash clouds and forced Australian airlines to cancel trips.

title.children: Bali flights are back on. But airlines are still monitoring volcanic activity

image.altText: A man looking on, seen from close up.

props.synopsis: The Sea Shepherd and Greenpeace co-founder has been detained since July, with supporters worried a move to extradite him to Japan would see him live the rest of his life in prison.

title.children: Supporters of anti-whaling activist Paul Watson dismayed as detention extended for fifth time

image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: Last year, the High Court found indefinite immigration detention was not legal. Now, two additional cases related to that decision have been heard.

title.children: High Court urged to find government illegally detained two men for too long

image.altText: Aldis Hodge and Isaiah Mustafa in character as Alex Cross and John Sampson, two Black men, well dressed, looking shocked

props.synopsis: The cast and crew of Cross sat down with ABC News and shared how the James Patterson crime thrillers might be the source material for the show, but the new TV series goes where the books and films didn't.

title.children: James Patterson's crime thrillers are available at most airports, now it's time for the TV treatment
